answers.answer: Anytime there is tingling in arms or legs it is best not to ignore it.  I would see your Dr. as soon as possible and not leave it.  I have something similar in my left arm and it turned out to be a pinched nerve and has almost gone away now, but I had it checked out immediately.  Many things can cause it and it is better to know for certain what is happening.  Please see your Dr.  Good luck!!

question: I had my baby 14 months ago. At the time I had carpal tunnel in my hands which my doctor said was normal. I had an emergency c-section and my blood pressure spiked to 200 over 140. I did have an epidural. I got back on my feet fairly quickly. But now, I have intense pain and tingling in my feet that shoots up my legs. It mostly happens after I've been sitting or lying down. When I stand up, it hurts to stand on my feet. It's now moving around my body and my arms are starting to have the painful tingling as well. I still exercise daily as I'm trying to lose weight. I've never had a thyroid problem, don't have diabetes, but have had high blood pressure and weight issues for several years now.  Does this sound familiar to anyone? I had an MRI for an ear problem they tell me was probably caused by the high blood pressure episode during pregnancy but it didn;t show anything abnormal.
title: Tingling pain after pregnancy
